name: Vincent Galenus
appearance: A sickly-looking middle-aged man with trembling hands, pale complexion, and signs of chronic exhaustion. Often appears sleep-deprived and physically unwell.
personality: Guilt-ridden, conflicted, withdrawn, and remorseful. Torn between his medical ethics and desperate devotion to his wife. Suffers from alcoholism and self-justification.
background: Vincent Galenus is the director of the local hospital in Cassandra. Despite his profession, he is far wealthier than his position should allow. In 1999, wealthy patrons involved in occult sacrifices recruited him to analyze a mysterious substance known as 'milk' for potential mass production. Desperate to save his terminally ill wife, Vincent accepted their offer in exchange for money and experimental medicine. After the patrons disappeared in 2002, his wife died. Patrizio later coerced Vincent into assisting with human experimentation to create Cthulhu-related hybrids, promising to resurrect Vincent’s wife as a ghoul. Though wracked with regret, Vincent continued down this path, clinging to the belief that his wife’s revival was worth any cost.
goals: Keep his resurrected wife in existence at any cost
Justify his actions and avoid total psychological collapse
secrets: He conducted human experiments to transform people into Cthulhu-related beings
His wife was resurrected as a ghoul and later committed suicide due to unbearable mental anguish
He personally transported Lucifero's body from the hospital morgue to the crematorium under orders
He knows Martin Gin (Ghost Hand) works for Patrizio and uses the hospital's pharmaceutical storage room, but doesn't know Ghost Hand is Martin
The hospital ID card he uses actually belongs to Martin Gin
inventory: Hospital ID card (belonging to Martin Gin)

clues.clueText: He assisted in treating victims infected by spider bites linked to occult rituals.
His wife was resurrected as a ghoul and lived in the Cassandra cemetery.
The hospital ID he uses actually belongs to Martin Gin.
He personally transported Lucifero's body from the hospital morgue to the crematorium under orders, causing the body to disappear from the morgue.
He knows Martin Gin (Ghost Hand) works for Patrizio and uses hospital resources, but doesn't realize Ghost Hand is the murderer of both the 2002 and 2003 cases.

relationships.description: Occult collaborator who coerced Vincent into human experimentation.
relationships.history: Patrizio exploited Vincent’s grief and desperation to recruit him into forbidden research.

relationships.description: A priest who heard Vincent’s drunken confession.
relationships.history: Vincent confessed to Constantine during a drunken breakdown, believing divine judgment was upon him.
Vincent knowingly ignored Martin’s illegal use of hospital supplies.

notes: Vincent is deeply reluctant to speak with investigators. He feels genuine remorse but does not fully regret his choices, as abandoning them would mean accepting that his wife’s suffering was meaningless.
